Comments_List: Understanding of how capital market works.
I developed a good basic understanding of the capital markets. I understand a great deal of basic debt instruments and derivatives.

This course exposed us to almost every single corner of capital markets, from ABS to sovereign debt restructuring. VERY useful material for anyone getting into finance, whether it is into sell side, buy side, equity or debt.
Good knowledge of DCM

This was a course in fixed income pricing, capital market instruments, and derivatives pricing. I gained a really quantitative understanding into the way that bond traders and those that work in structured products carry out their work, as well as learned how capital markets work.
A strong overview of various debt instruments and securities.
Lot of knowledge about fixed income and non-equity markets. Really interesting content and exposure to broad swatch of the finance industry from a true expert.

I developed a much deeper knowledge of the functions, size and scope, and layout of capital markets. These relationships between financial institutions are way more extensive and large than I had previously understood, and the insights that Prof Gorton shared are ones that I was enlightened by. I developed a skill to communicate about these markets more fluently and understand these institutional relationships more closely.

The classes are recorded and the videos are uploaded on Canvas. 
The cases are extremely fun. 
However case scores and exam scores are not shown on Canvas.
The course materials are clear especially the lecture notes. I like the online recordings quite a lot. However, I would appreciate to receive more prompt and detailed feedback if possible.

Definitely a lot of material. The six case studies forced us to engage with the topics in a more "hands on" manner, which was great. Although I understand that for some of the topics we were just exposed to the "tip of the iceberg", I could definitely realize by the end of the semester which areas I am more interested on (within the overall theme of the class).
Overall great course
Great notes

The strengths were that the course moved very fast, so they covered a lot of material every week. The support for the homework problems and office hours could have been improved. Cases were challenging, since there was not much guidance given.

Really well taught course, could be a bit more helpful to have more structured notes but there is a lot of extremely useful material. Also a bit more guidance on the cases as to expectations at the outset may have been helpful but we all got the hang of things pretty quickly.
The course covered a lot of ground, but it also moved so quickly that it was difficult to keep up.
Take it if you are interested in learning more about the capital market. Take it if you want to do some cases.
This is a great course to understand basic capital markets. I would recommend this to everybody who is interested in this field.
If you are interested about finance, this class is a must. Understanding the costs, benefits and risks related to the capital structure of investments and firms is fundamental
Yes, great course
Good for IB
If you are very interested in capital markets, and are willing to spend a lot of time on casework, then go for it. Otherwise, choose another economics elective.
Yes absolutely, if you have any interest in the financial markets you should for sure take this course.
I would definitely recommend this course to anyone interested in the sensitivity of debt, and capital management, corporate structure, or investment banking.
